CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)
        SET length AS THE COUNT OF s
        SET truth_matrix AS AN ARRAY (length) OF ARRAYS (length) FILLED WITH TRUE
        SET start_index AS 0
        SET max_length AS 1
        
        SET outer_index AS length MINUS 2
        WHILE outer_index IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0 DO
            SET inner_index AS outer_index PLUS 1
            WHILE inner_index IS LESS THAN length DO
                SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS FALSE
                
                IF NOT (s[outer_index] NOT EQUAL TO s[inner_index]) THEN
                    SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS truth_matrix[outer_index PLUS 1][inner_index MINUS 1]
                    
                    IF truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] IS TRUE THEN
                        IF (max_length LESS THAN (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)) THEN
                            SET start_index AS outer_index
                            SET max_length AS (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)
                        END IF
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            DECREMENT outer_index BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN s SUBSTRING FROM start_index TO (start_index PLUS max_length MINUS 1)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN substring from position k TO position k PLUS mx MINUS one of s  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION uniquePaths(m n)  
        SET matrix AS a list containing m elements, each being a list of length n filled with 1  
        SET rowIndex TO 1  
        WHILE rowIndex < m DO  
            SET columnIndex TO 1  
            WHILE columnIndex < n DO  
                SET currentRow TO matrix[rowIndex]  
                SET currentRow[columnIndex] TO matrix[rowIndex - 1][columnIndex] + currentRow[columnIndex - 1]  
                SET columnIndex TO columnIndex + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET rowIndex TO rowIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN matrix[m - 1][n - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION combine(n, k)
        FUNCTION backtrack(begin, sequence)
            IF NOT (LENGTH(sequence) NOT EQUAL TO k)
                result COLLECT COPY(sequence)
                RETURN
            END IF
            SET index TO begin
            WHILE index < n + 1
                sequence ADD index
                backtrack(index + 1, sequence)
                sequence REMOVE LAST
                index INCREASE BY 1
            END WHILE
        END FUNCTION
        result ASSIGN LIST()
        backtrack(1, LIST())
        RETURN result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

        FUNCTION backtrack WITH PARAMETERS start path  
            IF the LENGTH OF path EQUALS k  
                APPEND a COPY OF path TO result  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            FOR i FROM start TO n PLUS one  
                APPEND i TO path  
                CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS i PLUS one path  
                REMOVE the LAST ELEMENT FROM path  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
        SET result TO an EMPTY LIST  
        CALL backtrack WITH ARGUMENTS one AN EMPTY LIST  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION removeDuplicates(nums)  
        IF NOT (LENGTH OF nums > 0) THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        SET ptr AS 0  
        
        SET idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx <= (2 MINUS 1) AND idx <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[idx]  
            SET ptr AS ptr + 1  
            SET idx AS idx + 1

        SET cursor AS 2  
        WHILE cursor <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)

                # do nothing, skip increment  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[cursor]  
                SET ptr AS ptr PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            SET cursor AS cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN ptr  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        END IF

        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        SWITCH  
            CASE n > 2:  
                BREAK  
            DEFAULT:  
                RETURN 0  
        END SWITCH  
        SET primality_flags AS empty list  
        SET counter AS 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN n DO  
            ADD True TO primality_flags  
            SET counter TO counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET primality_flags[0] TO False  
        SET primality_flags[1] TO False  
        SET max_check AS FLOOR(SQRT(n))  
        SET candidate AS 2  
        WHILE candidate <= max_check DO  
            IF primality_flags[candidate] IS NOT False THEN  
                SET factor AS candidate * candidate  
                WHILE factor < n DO  
                    SET primality_flags[factor] TO False  
                    SET factor TO factor + candidate  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET candidate TO candidate + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET tally AS 0  
        FOR element IN primality_flags DO  
            IF element THEN tally ← tally + 1  
        END FOR  
        RETURN tally  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numSquares(n)  
        INITIALIZE dp AS a list WITH (n + 1) elements EACH SET TO infinity_value  
        ASSIGN dp[0] ← 0  
        INITIALIZE squares AS an empty list  
        ASSIGN counter ← 1  
        LOOP  
            IF (counter * counter) > n THEN EXIT LOOP  
            ADD (counter * counter) TO squares  
            SET counter ← counter + 1  
        END LOOP  
        ASSIGN index ← 1  
        WHILE index ≤ n DO  
            FOR EACH current_square IN squares DO  
                IF current_square > index THEN  
                    EXIT FOR  
                ELSE  
                    TEMP ← dp[index - current_square] + 1  
                    IF TEMP < dp[index] THEN  
                        SET dp[index] ← TEMP  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET index ← index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        WHILE i MULTIPLIED BY i IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            APPEND i MULTIPLIED BY i TO squares  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE

                END IF  
                SET dp at position i TO the smaller value BETWEEN dp at position i AND dp at position i MINUS square PLUS one  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)
        DECLARE cache AS an empty map

        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)
            IF NOT (state NOT IN cache) THEN
                RETURN cache[state]
            END IF

            DECLARE iterator AS 0
            WHILE iterator <= LENGTH(state) - 2 DO
                IF (state[iterator] = '+') AND (state[iterator + 1] = '+') THEN
                    DECLARE before_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, 0, iterator)
                    DECLARE after_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, iterator + 2, LENGTH(state))
                    DECLARE candidate_state AS CONCATENATE(before_segment, '--', after_segment)

                    IF FALSE = can_win_helper(candidate_state) THEN
                        ASSIGN TRUE TO cache[state]
                        RETURN TRUE
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN iterator + 1 TO iterator
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN FALSE TO cache[state]
            RETURN FALSE
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN can_win_helper(currentState)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)  
        SET memo TO an empty dictionary  
        
        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)  
            IF state EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN the value associated with state in memo  
            END IF  
            
            FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF state MINUS one MINUS one  
                IF the element at position index of state EQUALS the plus character AND the element at position index PLUS one of state EQUALS the plus character THEN  
                    SET new_state TO the substring from position zero TO position index MINUS one CONCATENATED WITH two minus characters CONCATENATED WITH the substring from position index PLUS two TO the END OF state  
                    IF the result of calling can_win_helper WITH new_state IS EQUAL TO false THEN  
                        SET the value associated with state in memo TO true  
                        RETURN true  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            SET the value associated with state in memo TO false  
            RETURN false  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling can_win_helper WITH currentState  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION coinChange(coins, amount)  
        SET cache AS a list containing (amount + 1) copies of (amount + 1)  
        ASSIGN 0 TO cache[0]  

        SET counter TO 1  
        WHILE counter ≤ amount  
            SET currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            FOR each denomination IN coins  
                SET remainder TO counter - denomination  
                IF remainder ≥ 0 THEN  
                    SET candidate TO cache[remainder] + 1  
                    IF candidate < currentMin THEN  
                        ASSIGN candidate TO currentMin  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            ASSIGN currentMin TO cache[counter]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF cache[amount] ≠ (amount + 1) THEN  
            RETURN cache[amount]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION isSelfCrossing(distance)
        ASSIGN lengthValue ← SIZE(distance)
        IF NOT (lengthValue ≥ 4) THEN
            RETURN False
        END IF

        SET index ← 3
        WHILE index ≤ lengthValue - 1 DO
            ASSIGN current ← distance[index]
            ASSIGN prev2 ← distance[index - 2]
            ASSIGN prev1 ← distance[index - 1]
            ASSIGN prev3 ← distance[index - 3]

            IF (current ≥ prev2) AND (prev1 ≤ prev3) THEN
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF (index ≥ 4) THEN
                ASSIGN prev3Check ← distance[index - 3]
                ASSIGN prev4Check ← distance[index - 4]
                IF (prev1 = prev3Check) AND ((current + prev4Check) ≥ prev2) THEN
                    RETURN True
                END IF
            END IF

            IF (index ≥ 5) THEN
                ASSIGN prev2Check ← distance[index - 2]
                ASSIGN prev4Check ← distance[index - 4]
                ASSIGN prev3Check ← distance[index - 3]
                ASSIGN prev1Check ← distance[index - 1]
                ASSIGN prev5Check ← distance[index - 5]

                IF (prev2Check ≥ prev4Check) AND (prev3Check ≥ prev1Check) AND ((prev1Check + prev5Check) ≥ prev3Check) AND ((current + prev4Check) ≥ prev2Check) THEN
                    RETURN True
                END IF
            END IF

            INCREMENT index BY 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                        SET currentMax TO secondProduct  
                END SWITCH  
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET dpList[outerCounter] TO currentMax  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dpList[n]

    FUNCTION wordsTyping(sentence, rows, cols)

        WHILE index_counter LESS THAN LENGTH OF sentence  
            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH sentence[index_counter]  
            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH " "  
            INCREMENT index_counter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        SET pointer TO 0  
        ASSIGN row_iter TO 1

                INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
            ELSE  
                WHILE (pointer GREATER THAN 0) AND (concatenated_string[(pointer - 1) MOD length_total] IS NOT " ")  
                    DECREASE pointer BY 1  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT row_iter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN INTEGER_DIVISION OF pointer BY length_total  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)
        SET length_password AS LENGTH OF password
        SET lower_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS lowercase letter
        SET upper_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS uppercase letter
        SET digit_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS digit

        SET missing_char_types AS 3 MINUS (lower_found PLUS upper_found PLUS digit_found)

        SET replacements_needed TO 0
        SET count_mod0 TO 0
        SET count_mod1 TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 2

        WHILE index_counter < length_password
            IF (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1]) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 2])
                SET streak_length TO 2
                WHILE (index_counter < length_password) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1])
                    SET streak_length TO (streak_length PLUS 1)
                    SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
                END WHILE

                SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed PLUS (streak_length DIV 3)

                IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 0
                    SET count_mod0 TO count_mod0 PLUS 1
                ELSE IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 1
                    SET count_mod1 TO count_mod1 PLUS 1
                END IF
            ELSE
                SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF length_password < 6
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND (6 MINUS length_password)
        ELSE IF length_password <= 20
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        ELSE
            SET excess_length TO length_password MINUS 20

            SET min_del0 AS MINIMUM OF excess_length AND count_mod0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS min_del0

            SET remaining_after_del0 TO MAXIMUM OF (excess_length MINUS min_del0) AND 0
            SET min_del1 AS MINIMUM OF remaining_after_del0 AND (count_mod1 TIMES 2)
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (min_del1 DIV 2)

            SET remaining_after_del1 TO MAXIMUM OF (remaining_after_del0 MINUS min_del1) AND 0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (remaining_after_del1 DIV 3)

            RETURN excess_length PLUS MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF password  
        
        SET has_lower TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is a lowercase letter  
        SET has_upper TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is an uppercase letter  
        SET has_digit TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is a digit  
        
        SET missing_types TO three MINUS the SUM OF has_lower PLUS has_upper PLUS has_digit  
        
        SET replace TO zero  
        SET one TO zero  
        SET two TO zero  
        SET i TO two  
        WHILE i LESS THAN n  
            IF the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS one of password AND the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS two of password  
                SET length TO two  
                WHILE i LESS THAN n AND the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS one of password  
                    INCREMENT length BY one  
                    INCREMENT i BY one  
                END WHILE  
                INCREMENT replace BY the INTEGER DIVISION of length BY three  
                IF the MODULO of length BY three EQUALS zero  
                    INCREMENT one BY one  
                ELSE IF the MODULO of length BY three EQUALS one  
                    INCREMENT two BY one  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        
        IF n LESS THAN six  
            RETURN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND six MINUS n  
        ELSE IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO twenty  
            RETURN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND replace  
        ELSE  
            SET delete TO n MINUS twenty  
            
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the SMALLER VALUE BETWEEN delete AND one  
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the INTEGER DIVISION BY two OF the SMALLER VALUE BETWEEN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN delete MINUS one AND zero AND two MULTIPLIED BY two  
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the INTEGER DIVISION BY three OF the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN delete MINUS one MINUS two MULTIPLIED BY two AND zero  
            
            RETURN delete PLUS the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND replace  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                APPEND STRING(numberIdx) TO collectionOfChars  
                ASSIGN countRepeat ← countRepeat - 1  
            END WHILE  
            ASSIGN numberIdx ← numberIdx + 1  
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s

                SET tempString ← tempString + ch  
            END FOR  
            SET outputString ← outputString + tempString  
            SET iterator ← iterator + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN outputString  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findMinDifference(timePoints)  
        FUNCTION to_minutes(time)  
            SET components TO EMPTY LIST  
            SET pos TO 0  
            WHILE pos LESS THAN length of time  
                IF time[pos] EQUALS ":"  
                    EXIT WHILE  
                ELSE  
                    ADD time[pos] TO components  
                    SET pos TO pos + 1  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            SET colon_index TO pos  
            
            SET hrs_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM 0 TO colon_index  
            SET mins_str TO SUBSTRING of time FROM colon_index + 1 TO length of time  
            
            SET hrs_num TO INTEGER parsed from hrs_str  
            SET mins_num TO INTEGER parsed from mins_str  
            RETURN hrs_num * 60 + mins_num  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET minute_values TO EMPTY LIST  
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length of timePoints  
            ADD to_minutes(timePoints[idx]) TO minute_values  
            SET idx TO idx + 1  
        END WHILE
        
        CALL sort ON minute_values IN ASCENDING ORDER  
        
        SET shortest_gap TO INFINITY  
        SET pointer TO 1  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of minute_values  
            SET gap TO minute_values[pointer] - minute_values[pointer - 1]  
            IF gap < shortest_gap THEN  
                SET shortest_gap TO gap  
            END IF  
            SET pointer TO pointer + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET wrap_gap TO 1440 - minute_values[length of minute_values - 1] + minute_values[0]  
        IF wrap_gap < shortest_gap THEN  
            SET shortest_gap TO wrap_gap  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN shortest_gap  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)

            INCREMENT count BY 1

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION nearestPalindromic(n)  
        SET lenCount AS LENGTH OF n  
        IF lenCount EQUALS 1  
            SET valNum AS integer VALUE OF n  
            RETURN string FORM valNum MINUS 1  
        END IF  
        
        SET candSet AS AN EMPTY SET  
        
        SET powLen AS 10 TO THE POWER OF lenCount  
        SET powLenMinusOne AS 10 TO THE POWER OF (lenCount MINUS 1)  
        
        ADD (powLen PLUS 1) TO candSet  
        ADD (powLenMinusOne MINUS 1) TO candSet  
        
        SET prefVal AS integer VALUE OF SUBSTRING OF n FROM 1 TO ((lenCount PLUS 1) DIVIDED BY 2)  
        
        SET idx AS -1  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO 1  
            SET newPrefNum AS prefVal PLUS idx  
            SET newPrefStr AS string FORM newPrefNum  
            
            IF (lenCount MOD 2) EQUALS 0 THEN
                SET revPart AS REVERSE OF newPrefStr  
                SET candStr AS newPrefStr CONCATENATED WITH revPart  
            ELSE  
                SET subRev AS REVERSE OF SUBSTRING OF newPrefStr FROM 1 TO (LENGTH OF newPrefStr MINUS 1)  
                SET candStr AS newPrefStr CONCATENATED WITH subRev  
            END IF  
            
            SET candNum AS integer VALUE OF candStr  
            ADD candNum TO candSet  
            
            SET idx AS idx PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET origNum AS integer VALUE OF n  
        IF candSet CONTAINS origNum THEN
            REMOVE origNum FROM candSet  
        END IF  
        
        SET bestCandidate AS NULL  
        SET minDist AS POSITIVE_INFINITY  
        
        FOR EACH num IN candSet  
            SET dist AS ABSOLUTE VALUE OF (num MINUS origNum)  
            IF (dist LESS THAN minDist) OR (dist EQUALS minDist AND num LESS THAN bestCandidate) THEN
                SET bestCandidate AS num  
                SET minDist AS dist  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN string FORM bestCandidate  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findIntegers(n)  
        ASSIGN binaryString ← ""  
        ASSIGN tempNumber ← n  
        WHILE tempNumber > 0  
            SET binaryString ← ( (tempNumber MOD 2) AS STRING ) + binaryString  
            SET tempNumber ← tempNumber DIV 2  
        END WHILE

        SET totalLength ← LENGTH OF binaryString  
        CREATE dp ARRAY WITH SIZE totalLength + 1 FILLED WITH 0  
        SET dp[0] ← 1  
        SET dp[1] ← 2  

        SET counter ← 2  
        WHILE counter ≤ totalLength  
            SET dp[counter] ← dp[counter - 1] + dp[counter - 2]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        SET accumulatedResult ← 0  
        SET lastBit ← 0  
        SET position ← 0  

        WHILE position < totalLength  
            SWITCH binaryString[position]  
                CASE '1':  
                    SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult + dp[totalLength - position - 1]  
                    IF lastBit = 1 THEN  
                        SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult - 1  
                        BREAK OUT OF LOOP  
                    END IF  
                    SET lastBit ← 1  
                DEFAULT:  
                    SET lastBit ← 0  
            END SWITCH  
            SET position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulatedResult + 1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION kInversePairs(n, k)
        ASSIGN 1000000007 TO MOD
        ASSIGN LIST containing (k + 1) zeros TO dp_row_template
        ASSIGN LIST containing (n + 1) copies of dp_row_template TO dp
        ASSIGN 1 TO dp[0][0]

        ASSIGN 1 TO outer_counter
        WHILE outer_counter <= n
            ASSIGN 0 TO cumulative_total
            ASSIGN 0 TO inner_index
            WHILE inner_index <= k
                ASSIGN cumulative_total + dp[outer_counter - 1][inner_index] TO cumulative_total
                IF cumulative_total >= MOD THEN
                    ASSIGN cumulative_total - MOD TO cumulative_total
                END IF
                IF inner_index >= outer_counter THEN
                    ASSIGN cumulative_total - dp[outer_counter - 1][inner_index - outer_counter] + MOD TO cumulative_total
                    IF cumulative_total >= MOD THEN
                        ASSIGN cumulative_total - MOD TO cumulative_total
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN cumulative_total TO dp[outer_counter][inner_index]
                ADD 1 TO inner_index
            END WHILE
            ADD 1 TO outer_counter
        END WHILE
        RETURN dp[n][k]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION scheduleCourse(courses)
        SORT courses BY course[1] IN ascending order
        INITIALIZE priority_queue AS an empty list
        SET accumulated_days TO 0
        
        INDEX idx = 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(courses) DO
            SET curr_course TO courses[idx]
            SET curr_duration TO curr_course[0]
            SET deadline TO curr_course[1]

            IF accumulated_days + curr_duration <= deadline THEN
                ADD -curr_duration INTO priority_queue USING heap push
                accumulated_days ← accumulated_days + curr_duration
            ELSE
                IF NOT (LENGTH(priority_queue) = 0) AND (-priority_queue[0]) > curr_duration THEN
                    accumulated_days ← accumulated_days + curr_duration + heap pop FROM priority_queue
                    ADD -curr_duration INTO priority_queue USING heap push
                END IF
            END IF

            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN LENGTH(priority_queue)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION judgeSquareSum WITH parameter c  
        SET upperBound AS INTEGER PART OF THE SQUARE ROOT OF c  
        SET lowerBound AS 0  
        LOOP FOREVER  
            IF lowerBound GREATER THAN upperBound THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET total AS (upperBound * upperBound) + (lowerBound * lowerBound)  
            SWITCH total COMPARED TO c  
                CASE EQUAL:  
                    RETURN true  
                CASE LESS:  
                    SET lowerBound TO lowerBound + 1  
                CASE GREATER:  
                    SET upperBound TO upperBound - 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            IF current_sum EQUALS c THEN  
                RETURN true  
            ELSE IF current_sum LESS THAN c THEN  
                INCREMENT left BY one  
            ELSE  
                DECREMENT right BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN false  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION solveEquation(equation)
        FUNCTION parse_side(side)
            SET delimiter TO '#'
            SET modified_side TO side
            SET modified_side TO REPLACE all occurrences of '+' in modified_side WITH delimiter concatenated with '+'
            SET modified_side TO REPLACE all occurrences of '-' in modified_side WITH delimiter concatenated with '-'
            SET tokens_list TO SPLIT modified_side BY delimiter

            SET coefficient_x TO 0
            SET total_number TO 0

            SET position TO 0
            WHILE position < LENGTH(tokens_list)
                SET element TO tokens_list[position]
                IF element = '' THEN
                    SET position TO position + 1
                    CONTINUE
                END IF

                SET contains_x TO FALSE
                SET char_index TO 0
                WHILE char_index < LENGTH(element)
                    IF element[char_index] = 'x' THEN
                        SET contains_x TO TRUE
                        BREAK
                    END IF
                    SET char_index TO char_index + 1
                END WHILE

                IF contains_x THEN
                    SWITCH element
                        CASE 'x':
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x + 1
                        CASE '+x':
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x + 1
                        CASE '-x':
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x - 1
                        DEFAULT:
                            SET extracted_number TO SUBSTRING(element, 0, LENGTH(element) - 1)
                            SET coefficient_x TO coefficient_x + TO_INTEGER(extracted_number)
                    END SWITCH
                ELSE
                    SET total_number TO total_number + TO_INTEGER(element)
                END IF

                SET position TO position + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN coefficient_x, total_number
        END FUNCTION

        SET parts TO SPLIT(equation, '=')
        SET left_part TO parts[0]
        SET right_part TO parts[1]

        SET left_coefficient, left_sum TO parse_side(left_part)
        SET right_coefficient, right_sum TO parse_side(right_part)

        SET net_coefficient TO left_coefficient - right_coefficient
        SET net_sum TO right_sum - left_sum

        IF NOT (net_coefficient <> 0) THEN
            IF NOT (net_sum <> 0) THEN
                RETURN "Infinite solutions"
            ELSE
                RETURN "No solution"
            END IF
        ELSE
            RETURN CONCAT("x=", TO_STRING(net_sum DIV net_coefficient))
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            SET x_count TO zero

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION predictPartyVictory(senate)  
        DECLARE radiantQueue AS an empty double-ended queue  
        DECLARE direQueue AS an empty double-ended queue  

        INITIALIZE counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN LENGTH of senate  
            DECLARE partyChar AS senate[counter]  
            IF NOT (partyChar NOT EQUAL TO 'R')  
                APPEND counter TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND counter TO direQueue  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        DECLARE radiantLen AS LENGTH of senate  

        LOOP INDEFINITELY  
            IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY OR direQueue IS EMPTY THEN  
                BREAK  
            END IF  

            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM radiantQueue AND ASSIGN TO radiantPos  
            REMOVE FIRST ELEMENT FROM direQueue AND ASSIGN TO direPos  

            IF radiantPos - direPos < 0 THEN  
                APPEND radiantPos + radiantLen TO radiantQueue  
            ELSE  
                APPEND direPos + radiantLen TO direQueue  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  

        IF radiantQueue IS EMPTY IS FALSE THEN  
            RETURN "Radiant"  
        END IF  
        RETURN "Dire"  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumDeleteSum(s1, s2)  
        SET length_s1 AS LENGTH OF s1  
        SET length_s2 AS LENGTH OF s2  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (length_s1 + 1) ROWS AND (length_s2 + 1) COLUMNS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        SET idx_col TO 1  
        WHILE idx_col <= length_s2  
            LET previous_value BE dp[0][idx_col - 1]  
            LET ascii_code BE ASCII OF s2[idx_col - 1]  
            dp[0][idx_col] ← previous_value + ascii_code  
            idx_col ← idx_col + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET idx_row TO 1  
        WHILE idx_row <= length_s1  
            LET previous_value_row BE dp[idx_row - 1][0]  
            LET ascii_code_row BE ASCII OF s1[idx_row - 1]  
            dp[idx_row][0] ← previous_value_row + ascii_code_row  
            idx_row ← idx_row + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outer_index TO 1  
        WHILE outer_index <= length_s1  
            SET inner_index TO 1  
            WHILE inner_index <= length_s2  
                LET char_s1 BE s1[outer_index - 1]  
                LET char_s2 BE s2[inner_index - 1]  
                IF char_s1 ≠ char_s2 THEN
                    LET deletion_s1 COST ← dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index] + ASCII OF char_s1  
                    LET deletion_s2 COST ← dp[outer_index][inner_index - 1] + ASCII OF char_s2  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE MINIMUM OF deletion_s1 COST AND deletion_s2 COST  
                ELSE  
                    LET dp[outer_index][inner_index] BE dp[outer_index - 1][inner_index - 1]  
                END IF  
                inner_index ← inner_index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            outer_index ← outer_index + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[length_s1][length_s2]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPalindromicSubsequences WITH PARAMETER s  
        DECLARE MOD AS 1000000007  
        DECLARE length_s AS LENGTH OF s  
        
        DECLARE next_occurrence AS LIST CONTAINING 4 ELEMENTS EACH INITIALIZED TO LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS SET TO -1  
        DECLARE prev_occurrence AS LIST CONTAINING 4 ELEMENTS EACH INITIALIZED TO LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS SET TO -1  
        
        SET index_c TO 0  
        WHILE index_c LESS THAN 4 DO  
            SET current_char TO CHARACTER AT (ASCII('a') + index_c)  
            SET last_seen TO -1  
            
            SET pos_idx TO 0  
            WHILE pos_idx LESS THAN length_s DO  
                IF s ELEMENT AT pos_idx EQUALS current_char THEN  
                    SET last_seen TO pos_idx  
                END IF  
                SET prev_occurrence[index_c][pos_idx] TO last_seen  
                INCREMENT pos_idx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            SET last_seen TO -1  
            SET pos_idx TO length_s - 1  
            WHILE pos_idx GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
                IF s ELEMENT AT pos_idx EQUALS current_char THEN  
                    SET last_seen TO pos_idx  
                END IF  
                SET next_occurrence[index_c][pos_idx] TO last_seen  
                DECREMENT pos_idx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            INCREMENT index_c BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        DECLARE dp AS LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS EACH BEING A LIST OF length_s ELEMENTS SET TO 0  
        
        SET diag_idx TO 0  
        WHILE diag_idx LESS THAN length_s DO  
            SET dp[diag_idx][diag_idx] TO 1  
            INCREMENT diag_idx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET current_len TO 2  
        WHILE current_len LESS OR EQUAL TO length_s DO  
            SET start_pos TO 0  
            WHILE start_pos + current_len - 1 LESS THAN length_s DO  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos + current_len - 1  
                SET color_code TO 0  
                WHILE color_code LESS THAN 4 DO  
                    SET current_char TO CHARACTER AT (ASCII('a') + color_code)  
                    SET left_idx TO next_occurrence[color_code][start_pos]  
                    SET right_idx TO prev_occurrence[color_code][end_pos]  
                    
                    IF left_idx GREATER THAN end_pos OR right_idx LESS THAN start_pos THEN  
                        # skip this iteration  
                    ELSE  
                        IF left_idx EQUALS right_idx THEN  
                            SET dp[start_pos][end_pos] TO (dp[start_pos][end_pos] + 1) MOD MOD  
                        ELSE  
                            DECLARE addition AS dp[left_idx + 1][right_idx - 1]  
                            dp[start_pos][end_pos] ← (dp[start_pos][end_pos] + addition + 2) MOD MOD  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    
                    INCREMENT color_code BY 1  
                END WHILE  
                INCREMENT start_pos BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT current_len BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[0][length_s - 1]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)

            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF

        END WHILE

            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO

                IF posA > posB THEN

                END IF  
            END IF

        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean

                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx
                    LET divisor = ty
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))

                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))

                    END IF

            ELSE

                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            END IF

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        ASSIGN size TO LENGTH(graph)  
        ASSIGN paint TO ARRAY OF size ELEMENTS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(vertex, shade)  
            paint[vertex] = shade  
            SET index TO 0  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[vertex])  
                ASSIGN adj TO graph[vertex][index]  
                IF paint[adj] == shade THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF paint[adj] == 0 THEN  
                    IF dfs(adj, -shade) == False THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                index = index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter < size  
            IF paint[counter] == 0 THEN  
                IF dfs(counter, 1) == False THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET dp1 AS a list initialized with zeros, size n PLUS 1

            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN dp[n]  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION soupServings(n)
        CASE
            WHEN n <= 4800 THEN
                SET n AS (n + 24) DIV 25
            ELSE
                RETURN 1.0
        END CASE

        SET cache AS empty dictionary

        FUNCTION dp(a, b)
            DEPLOY
                VARIABLE key AS (a, b)
            RETRIEVE
                IF key IN cache THEN
                    RETURN cache[key]
                END IF
            STOP

            IF a <= 0 THEN
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.5
                ELSE
                    RETURN 1.0
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF b <= 0 THEN
                    RETURN 0.0
                END IF
            END IF

            VARIABLE p1 AS dp(a - 4, b)
            VARIABLE p2 AS dp(a - 3, b - 1)
            VARIABLE p3 AS dp(a - 2, b - 2)
            VARIABLE p4 AS dp(a - 1, b - 3)

            VARIABLE prob AS 0.25 * (p1 + p2 + p3 + p4)
            SET cache[key] AS prob

            RETURN prob
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(n, n)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

        IF n GREATER THAN four thousand eight hundred THEN  
            RETURN one point zero  
        END IF  
        SET n TO n PLUS twenty four DIVIDED BY twenty five  
        SET memo TO empty dictionary  
        FUNCTION dp(a, b)  
            IF tuple of a AND b EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN value of tuple of a AND b IN memo  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point five  
            END IF  
            IF a LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN one point zero  
            END IF  
            IF b LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                RETURN zero point zero  
            END IF  
            SET prob TO zero point two five MULTIPLIED BY sum of dp of a MINUS four AND b PLUS dp of a MINUS three AND b MINUS one PLUS dp of a MINUS two AND b MINUS two PLUS dp of a MINUS one AND b MINUS three  
            SET value of tuple of a AND b IN memo TO prob  
            RETURN prob  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dp of n AND n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF NOT (source NOT EQUAL target)  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE busMap AS a new empty mapping DefaultDict of list  
        SET i TO 0  
        WHILE i LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes  
            SET currentRoute TO routes[i]  
            SET j TO 0  
            WHILE j LESS THAN LENGTH OF currentRoute  
                APPEND i TO busMap[currentRoute[j]]  
                SET j TO j PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET i TO i PLUS 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE queue AS an empty double ended queue  
        INITIALIZE visitedBuses AS an empty set  
        INITIALIZE seenStops AS an empty set  

        FOR each busIndex IN busMap[source]  
            ENQUEUE (busIndex, 1) INTO queue  
            INSERT busIndex INTO visitedBuses  
        END FOR  
        INSERT source INTO seenStops  

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY  
            DEQUEUE FROM queue INTO currentBus, currentCount  

            SET k TO 0  
            WHILE k LESS THAN LENGTH OF routes[currentBus]  
                SET currStop TO routes[currentBus][k]  

                IF currStop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN currentCount  
                END IF  

                IF currStop NOT IN seenStops  
                    INSERT currStop INTO seenStops  

                    FOR each nextBus IN busMap[currStop]  
                        IF nextBus NOT IN visitedBuses  
                            INSERT nextBus INTO visitedBuses  
                            ENQUEUE (nextBus, currentCount PLUS 1) INTO queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  

                SET k TO k PLUS 1  
            END WHILE  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION numBusesToDestination(routes PARAMETER, source PARAMETER, target PARAMETER)  
        IF source EQUALS target  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  

        SET stop_to_buses TO an empty mapping from keys to empty lists  
        FOR each bus WITH index bus_index AND route IN routes  
            FOR each stop IN route  
                APPEND bus_index TO the list corresponding to stop IN stop_to_buses  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        SET bus_queue TO an empty double ended queue  
        SET visited_buses TO an empty set  
        SET visited_stops TO an empty set  

        FOR each bus IN the list of buses at the source stop FROM stop_to_buses  
            APPEND the tuple consisting of bus AND one TO bus_queue  
            ADD bus TO visited_buses  
            ADD source TO visited_stops  
        END FOR  

        WHILE bus_queue is not empty  
            REMOVE the first element FROM bus_queue AND ASSIGN the elements TO current_bus AND bus_count  

            FOR each stop IN the route at position current_bus OF routes  
                IF stop EQUALS target  
                    RETURN bus_count  
                END IF  

                IF stop NOT IN visited_stops  
                    ADD stop TO visited_stops  
                    FOR each next_bus IN the list of buses at stop FROM stop_to_buses  
                        IF next_bus NOT IN visited_buses  
                            ADD next_bus TO visited_buses  
                            APPEND the tuple consisting of next_bus AND bus_count PLUS one TO bus_queue  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN negative one  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION racecar(target)  
        DECLARE sequence ← new double ended queue containing [(0, 1, 0)]  
        DECLARE visited ← empty set  
        INSERT (0, 1) INTO visited  
        
        LOOP indefinitely  
            IF sequence IS empty THEN BREAK  
            END IF  
            
            POP (current_pos, current_spd, current_steps) FROM the front of sequence  
            
            SWITCH  
                CASE current_pos = target:  
                    RETURN current_steps  
                DEFAULT:  
                    CONTINUE  
            END SWITCH  
            
            SET projected_pos TO current_pos + current_spd  
            SET projected_spd TO current_spd × 2  
            
            IF NOT ((projected_pos, projected_spd) IN visited) AND 0 ≤ projected_pos < (2 × target) THEN  
                INSERT (projected_pos, projected_spd) INTO visited  
                ENQUEUE (projected_pos, projected_spd, current_steps + 1) TO the rear of sequence  
            END IF  
            
            DECLARE alt_spd  
            IF current_spd > 0 THEN  
                alt_spd ← -1  
            ELSE  
                alt_spd ← +1  
            END IF  
            
            IF NOT ((current_pos, alt_spd) IN visited) AND 0 ≤ current_pos < (2 × target) THEN  
                INSERT (current_pos, alt_spd) INTO visited  
                ENQUEUE (current_pos, alt_spd, current_steps + 1) TO the rear of sequence  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)

        WHILE index LESS THAN the LENGTH OF fronts  
            SET front_val TO fronts[index]  
            SET back_val TO backs[index]  
            IF front_val EQUAL back_val THEN

            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE

            END IF  
        END FOR

            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        ASSIGN MODULO_CONST ← (10 ^ 9) + 7  
        SORT arr BY ascending order  
        
        INITIALIZE factorsCount AS empty mapping  
        FOR each element IN arr DO  
            SET factorsCount[element] ← 1  
        END FOR  
        
        SET outerIdx ← 0  
        WHILE outerIdx < LENGTH(arr) DO  
            SET currentVal ← arr[outerIdx]  
            SET innerIdx ← 0  
            WHILE innerIdx < outerIdx DO  
                SET divisorCandidate ← arr[innerIdx]  
                IF (currentVal − (currentVal DIV divisorCandidate) * divisorCandidate) = 0 THEN  
                    SET pairedFactor ← currentVal DIV divisorCandidate  
                    IF pairedFactor IN factorsCount THEN  
                        SET product ← factorsCount[divisorCandidate] * factorsCount[pairedFactor]  
                        SET factorsCount[currentVal] ← (factorsCount[currentVal] + product) MODULO MODULO_CONST  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN accumulation ← 0  
        FOR each countValue IN factorsCount DO  
            SET accumulation ← accumulation + countValue  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN accumulation MODULO MODULO_CONST  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numMagicSquaresInside(grid)  
        FUNCTION is_magic(i, j)  
            IF grid[i][j] ≠ 5 THEN  
                RETURN False  
            END IF  

            SET unique_values AS empty set  
            SET a AS i - 1  
            WHILE a ≤ i + 1 DO  
                SET b AS j - 1  
                WHILE b ≤ j + 1 DO  
                    SET val AS grid[a][b]  
                    IF val < 1 OR val > 9 OR val IN unique_values THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                    INSERT val INTO unique_values  
                    b ← b + 1  
                END WHILE  
                a ← a + 1  
            END WHILE  

            SET c AS i - 1  
            REPEAT UNTIL c > i + 1  
                SET row_sum AS grid[c][j - 1] + grid[c][j] + grid[c][j + 1]  
                SET col_sum AS grid[i - 1][c] + grid[i][c] + grid[i + 1][c]  

                IF row_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF col_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  

                c ← c + 1  
            END REPEAT  

            SWITCH TRUE  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j - 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j + 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j + 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j - 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
            END SWITCH  

            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET total_count AS 0  
        SET row_count AS LENGTH(grid)  
        SET column_count AS LENGTH(grid[0])  
        SET idx_i AS 1  
        WHILE idx_i < row_count - 1 DO  
            SET idx_j AS 1  
            WHILE idx_j < column_count - 1 DO  
                IF is_magic(idx_i, idx_j) THEN  
                    total_count ← total_count + 1  
                END IF  
                idx_j ← idx_j + 1  
            END WHILE  
            idx_i ← idx_i + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN total_count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)
        SET length_arr AS LENGTH OF arr
        SET maximum_length TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 1
        LOOP
            IF NOT (index_counter < length_arr - 1) THEN
                BREAK
            END IF

            IF (arr[index_counter - 1] < arr[index_counter]) AND (arr[index_counter] > arr[index_counter + 1]) THEN
                SET left_marker AS index_counter - 1
                SET right_marker AS index_counter + 1

                WHILE (left_marker > 0) AND (arr[left_marker - 1] < arr[left_marker])
                    left_marker ← left_marker - 1
                END WHILE

                WHILE (right_marker < length_arr - 1) AND (arr[right_marker] > arr[right_marker + 1])
                    right_marker ← right_marker + 1
                END WHILE

                SET current_mountain_length AS right_marker - left_marker + 1
                IF maximum_length < current_mountain_length THEN
                    maximum_length ← current_mountain_length
                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker
            ELSE
                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF
        END LOOP
        RETURN maximum_length
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION loudAndRich(richer, quiet)
        graph ← default dictionary with list as default value
        iterator ← 0
        WHILE iterator < LENGTH(richer)
            pair ← richer[iterator]
            graph[pair[1]] APPEND pair[0]
            iterator ← iterator + 1
        END WHILE

        n ← LENGTH(quiet)
        answer ← new list of size n FILLED WITH -1

        FUNCTION dfs(person)
            IF NOT (answer[person] ≠ -1) THEN
                answer[person] ← person
                index ← 0
                WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[person])
                    neighbor ← graph[person][index]
                    candidate ← dfs(neighbor)

                        answer[person] ← candidate
                    END IF
                    index ← index + 1
                END WHILE
            END IF
            RETURN answer[person]
        END FUNCTION

        counter ← 0
        WHILE counter < n
            dfs(counter)
            counter ← counter + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN answer
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION carFleet(target, position, speed)  
        SET combinedPairs AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF position  
            APPEND (position[idx], speed[idx]) TO combinedPairs  
            INCREMENT idx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SORT combinedPairs BY FIRST ELEMENT DESCENDING  

        SET arrivalTimes AS EMPTY LIST  
        SET pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex LESS THAN LENGTH OF combinedPairs  
            LET loc BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][0]  
            LET vel BE combinedPairs[pairIndex][1]  
            LET timeVal BE (target MINUS loc) DIVIDED BY vel  
            APPEND timeVal TO arrivalTimes  
            INCREMENT pairIndex BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET fleetCount TO 0  
        SET maxObservedTime TO 0  

        SET timeIdx TO 0  
        WHILE timeIdx LESS THAN LENGTH OF arrivalTimes  
            LET currentTime BE arrivalTimes[timeIdx]  
            IF NOT (currentTime LESS OR EQUAL maxObservedTime) THEN  
                SET maxObservedTime TO currentTime  
                SET fleetCount TO fleetCount PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT timeIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN fleetCount  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION shortestPathAllKeys(grid)  
        SET vectors AS the collection of pairs [(1,0), (-1,0), (0,1), (0,-1)]  
        SET height AS LENGTH OF grid  
        SET width AS LENGTH OF grid AT INDEX zero  
        SET origin WITH NO INITIAL VALUE  
        SET total_keys AS 0  
        SET row_idx AS 0  
        WHILE row_idx < height  
            SET col_idx AS 0  
            WHILE col_idx < width  
                IF grid AT row_idx AND col_idx IS '@' THEN  
                    SET origin TO (row_idx, col_idx)  
                ELSE IF 'a' <= grid AT row_idx AND col_idx AND grid AT row_idx AND col_idx <= 'z' THEN  
                    SET total_keys TO total_keys + 1  
                END IF  
                SET col_idx TO col_idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET row_idx TO row_idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET frontier AS A new deque INITIALIZED WITH [(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0, 0)]  
        SET encountered AS A set WITH {(origin AT INDEX zero, origin AT INDEX one, 0)}  
        
        WHILE NOT EMPTY frontier  
            SET curr_x, curr_y, acquired_keys, step_count TO POP LEFT frontier  
            FOR EACH vector_x, vector_y IN vectors  
                SET next_x TO curr_x + vector_x  
                SET next_y TO curr_y + vector_y  
                
                IF 0 <= next_x AND next_x < height AND 0 <= next_y AND next_y < width THEN  
                    SET cell_value TO grid AT next_x AND next_y  
                    IF cell_value = '#' THEN  
                        CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'A' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'Z' THEN  
                        SET lock_bit TO 1 << (ORD(LOWERCASE cell_value) - ORD('a'))  
                        IF (acquired_keys & lock_bit) = 0 THEN  
                            CONTINUE TO NEXT ITERATION  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    IF 'a' <= cell_value AND cell_value <= 'z' THEN  
                        SET updated_keys TO (acquired_keys | 1 << (ORD cell_value - ORD 'a'))  
                        IF updated_keys = (1 << total_keys) - 1 THEN  
                            RETURN step_count + 1  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE  
                        SET updated_keys TO acquired_keys  
                    END IF  
                    
                    IF (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) NOT IN encountered THEN  
                        ADD (next_x, next_y, updated_keys) TO encountered  
                        APPEND (next_x, next_y, updated_keys, step_count + 1) TO frontier  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN -1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    END FUNCTION

        WHILE pointer LESS THAN count

        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulator
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION movesToStamp(stamp string, target string) RETURNS list of integers  
        DEFINE totalStampLen AS LENGTH(stamp)  
        DEFINE totalTargetLen AS LENGTH(target)  
        DEFINE incomingEdges AS ARRAY OF SIZE (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1) FILLED WITH totalStampLen  
        DEFINE processingQueue AS NEW double ended queue (empty)  
        DEFINE adjacencyList AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen EACH CONTAINING EMPTY LIST  

        DEFINE outerIndex AS 0  
        WHILE outerIndex LESS THAN (totalTargetLen - totalStampLen + 1)  
            DEFINE innerIndex AS 0  
            REPEAT  
                IF innerIndex EQUALS totalStampLen THEN  
                    BREAK  
                END IF  
                DEFINE currentStampChar AS stamp[innerIndex]  
                IF target[outerIndex + innerIndex] EQUALS currentStampChar THEN  
                    incomingEdges[outerIndex] ← incomingEdges[outerIndex] - 1  
                    IF incomingEdges[outerIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                        processingQueue.APPEND(outerIndex)  
                    END IF  
                ELSE  
                    adjacencyList[outerIndex + innerIndex].APPEND(outerIndex)  
                END IF  
                SET innerIndex TO innerIndex + 1  
            END REPEAT  
            SET outerIndex TO outerIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        DEFINE result AS EMPTY LIST  
        DEFINE visited AS ARRAY OF SIZE totalTargetLen FILLED WITH False  

        FUNCTION processQueue() RETURNS VOID  
            IF processingQueue.IS_EMPTY() THEN RETURN END IF  
            DEFINE currentIndex AS processingQueue.POP_LEFT()  
            result.APPEND(currentIndex)  
            DEFINE idx AS 0  
            WHILE idx LESS THAN totalStampLen  
                DEFINE pos AS currentIndex + idx  
                IF visited[pos] EQUALS False THEN  
                    visited[pos] ← True  
                    FOR EACH sourceIndex IN adjacencyList[pos]  
                        incomingEdges[sourceIndex] ← incomingEdges[sourceIndex] - 1  
                        IF incomingEdges[sourceIndex] EQUALS 0 THEN  
                            processingQueue.APPEND(sourceIndex)  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
                SET idx TO idx + 1  
            END WHILE  
            processQueue()  
        END FUNCTION  

        processQueue()  

        FOR marker IN visited  
            IF marker EQUALS False THEN  
                RETURN EMPTY LIST  
            END IF  
        END FOR

        RETURN REVERSE(result)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION distinctSubseqII(s)  
        SET modValue AS 1_000_000_007  
        SET lengthOfString AS LENGTH OF s  
        SET dpArray AS A LIST CONTAINING ZEROS OF SIZE lengthOfString PLUS 1  
        SET dpArray AT 0 AS 1  
        SET seenPositions AS AN EMPTY MAP

                SET dpArray AT indexCounter AS updatedValue MODULO modValue  
            END IF  
            
            SET seenPositions AT currentCharacter AS indexCounter  
            INCREMENT indexCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET finalResult AS dpArray AT lengthOfString MINUS 1  
        RETURN finalResult MODULO modValue  
    END FUNCTION

            idxC ← idxC + 1  
        END WHILE

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION gridIllumination(n, lamps, queries)  
        INITIALIZE freqRows AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqCols AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqDiags AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE freqAntiDiags AS a dictionary defaulting to 0  
        INITIALIZE activeLamps AS an empty set  
        
        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(lamps)  
            LET x TO lamps[idx][0]  
            LET y TO lamps[idx][1]  
            IF NOT (x, y) IN activeLamps  
                INSERT (x, y) INTO activeLamps  
                freqRows[x] ← freqRows[x] + 1  
                freqCols[y] ← freqCols[y] + 1  
                LET dKey TO x - y  
                LET adKey TO x + y  
                freqDiags[dKey] ← freqDiags[dKey] + 1  
                freqAntiDiags[adKey] ← freqAntiDiags[adKey] + 1  
            END IF  
            idx ← idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        DECLARE neighbors AS a list containing (-1, -1), (-1, 0), (-1, 1), (0, -1), (0, 0), (0, 1), (1, -1), (1, 0), (1, 1)  
        
        DEFINE results AS an empty list  
        
        SET qIndex TO 0  
        WHILE qIndex < LENGTH(queries)  
            LET currRow TO queries[qIndex][0]  
            LET currCol TO queries[qIndex][1]  
            
            IF freqRows[currRow] > 0 OR freqCols[currCol] > 0 OR freqDiags[currRow - currCol] > 0 OR freqAntiDiags[currRow + currCol] > 0 THEN  
                APPEND 1 TO results  
            ELSE  
                APPEND 0 TO results  
            END IF  
            
            DECLARE nIndex AS 0  
            WHILE nIndex < LENGTH(neighbors)  
                LET deltaRow TO neighbors[nIndex][0]  
                LET deltaCol TO neighbors[nIndex][1]  
                LET newRow TO currRow + deltaRow  
                LET newCol TO currCol + deltaCol  
                
                IF (newRow, newCol) IN activeLamps THEN  
                    DELETE (newRow, newCol) FROM activeLamps  
                    freqRows[newRow] ← freqRows[newRow] - 1  
                    freqCols[newCol] ← freqCols[newCol] - 1  
                    freqDiags[newRow - newCol] ← freqDiags[newRow - newCol] - 1

    FUNCTION parseBoolExpr(expression)  
        INITIALIZE container AS empty list  
        SET pointer TO 0  
        WHILE pointer LESS THAN length of expression  
            LET symbol BE element at position pointer in expression  
            
            SWITCH symbol  
                CASE 't', 'f', '!', '&', '|'  
                    ADD symbol TO container  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
                    CONTINUE  
                CASE ')'  
                    DECLARE tally_true AS 0  
                    DECLARE tally_false AS 0  
                    
                    WHILE container[last element] IS 't' OR container[last element] IS 'f'  
                        LET current_char BE container[last element]  
                        
                        IF current_char IS 't'  
                            SET tally_true TO tally_true + 1  
                        END IF  
                        IF current_char IS 'f'  
                            SET tally_false TO tally_false + 1  
                        END IF  
                        REMOVE last element FROM container  
                    END WHILE  
                    
                    LET operator_char BE container[last element]  
                    REMOVE last element FROM container  
                    
                    IF operator_char IS '!'  
                        IF tally_false NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE IF operator_char IS '&'  
                        IF tally_false NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        END IF  
                    ELSE IF operator_char IS '|'  
                        IF tally_true NOT EQUAL TO 0  
                            SET symbol TO 't'  
                        ELSE  
                            SET symbol TO 'f'  
                        END IF  
                    END IF  
                    ADD symbol TO container  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
                DEFAULT  
                    INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
            END SWITCH  
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)  
        LET lengthVar BE LENGTH OF s  
        LET highestChar BE MAXIMUM CHARACTER IN s  
        LET positions BE AN EMPTY LIST

            IF s[index] = highestChar THEN

            LET substringStart BE positions[posIndex]

            IF NOT (candidateSubstring >= tempSubstring) THEN  
                SET candidateSubstring TO tempSubstring  
            END IF  
            SET posIndex TO posIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN candidateSubstring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION countVowelPermutation(n)
        DEFINE DIVISOR AS 1_000_000_007
        INITIALIZE alpha AS 1
        INITIALIZE beta AS 1
        INITIALIZE gamma AS 1
        INITIALIZE delta AS 1
        INITIALIZE epsilon AS 1

        SET counter TO 2
        WHILE counter ≤ n DO
            DEFINE next_alpha AS beta + gamma + epsilon
            DEFINE next_beta AS alpha + gamma
            DEFINE next_gamma AS beta + delta
            DEFINE next_delta AS gamma
            DEFINE next_epsilon AS gamma + delta

            alpha ← next_alpha MODULO DIVISOR
            beta ← next_beta MODULO DIVISOR
            gamma ← next_gamma MODULO DIVISOR
            delta ← next_delta MODULO DIVISOR
            epsilon ← next_epsilon MODULO DIVISOR

            INCREMENT counter BY 1
        END WHILE

        COMPUTE aggregate_total = alpha + beta + gamma + delta + epsilon
        ASSIGN final_result AS aggregate_total MODULO DIVISOR
        RETURN final_result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION dieSimulator(n, rollMax)

            temp_list[1] ← 1
            idx ← idx + 1
        END WHILE

                        dp[i][j][k] ← acc MOD MOD
                    ELSE
                        dp[i][j][k] ← dp[i - 1][j][k - 1]

                    k ← k + 1

                j ← j + 1
            END WHILE

            END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION maxValueAfterReverse(nums)
        ASSIGN SIZE OF nums TO lengthCounter
        IF NOT (lengthCounter GREATER THAN 2) THEN
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[0] - nums[1]) TO resultVal
            RETURN resultVal
        END IF

        ASSIGN 0 TO sumAbsDiff
        ASSIGN 1 TO idx

            ASSIGN idx + 1 TO idx
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN 1 TO pointerA
        WHILE pointerA LESS THAN lengthCounter
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[0] - nums[pointerA]) - ABS(nums[pointerA] - nums[pointerA - 1]) TO candidateGainA
            IF candidateGainA GREATER THAN edgeMaxGain THEN
                ASSIGN candidateGainA TO edgeMaxGain
            END IF
            ASSIGN pointerA + 1 TO pointerA
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN 0 TO pointerB
        WHILE pointerB LESS THAN lengthCounter - 1
            ASSIGN ABS(nums[lengthCounter - 1] - nums[pointerB]) - ABS(nums[pointerB + 1] - nums[pointerB]) TO candidateGainB
            IF candidateGainB GREATER THAN edgeMaxGain THEN
                ASSIGN candidateGainB TO edgeMaxGain
            END IF
            ASSIGN pointerB + 1 TO pointerB
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN +Infinity TO minMaxPair
        ASSIGN -Infinity TO maxMinPair
        ASSIGN 0 TO iteratorC
        WHILE iteratorC LESS THAN lengthCounter - 1
            ASSIGN MAX(nums[iteratorC], nums[iteratorC + 1]) TO currentMaxVal
            IF currentMaxVal LESS THAN minMaxPair THEN

            END IF

            ASSIGN MIN(nums[iteratorC], nums[iteratorC + 1]) TO currentMinVal
            IF currentMinVal GREATER THAN maxMinPair THEN
                ASSIGN currentMinVal TO maxMinPair
            END IF
            ASSIGN iteratorC + 1 TO iteratorC
        END WHILE

    FUNCTION maxValueAfterReverse(nums)

            RETURN the ABSOLUTE VALUE OF element at position zero of nums MINUS element at position one of nums  
        END IF

            INCREMENT initial_value BY the ABSOLUTE VALUE OF element at position i of nums MINUS element at position i MINUS one of nums  
        END FOR
